Articles.Content:
When I\'m not flying doomed rockets or working on schoolwork, I often play around in SpaceEngine and have made a few videos of it. I just finished my latest one last night, and was wondering if you could give your opinions on it and if necessary constructive criticism.

SpaceEngine Series - The Universe 3

Also, does anyone else play this? I think it\'s awesome.

That was amazing.

The beauty of the universe with piano music, it\'s just awesome.

Dude. That\'s amazing. Awesome choice of music, too.

I\'ve never heard of SpaceEngine. What is it?
love the vid but one thing, did you take the song from the Chris moyles show on bbc radio1? he plays an ochestral piece of this at around 7:20 in tha mornin and calls it his classical class.

Dude. That\'s amazing. Awesome choice of music, too.

I\'ve never heard of SpaceEngine. What is it?

It\'s a game where you simply explore space. It\'s placed in the Virgo supercluster, and it procedurally generates everything that isn\'t put in manually, leaving you with billions and billions (or maybe trillions?) of places to explore. But it\'s hard on a computer, so you need to be prepared for crashes if you don\'t have the stuff to run it.

love the vid but one thing, did you take the song from the Chris moyles show on bbc radio1? he plays an ochestral piece of this at around 7:20 in tha mornin and calls it his classical class.

No, I just googled it and then got if off a 4shared. If you\'re wondering if it\'s his song, no, it\'s by Claude Debussy.

I love space engine but i cant render the planets fast enough to see the planets in the atmospheres

leaving you with billions and billions (or maybe trillions?) of places to explore.

If you can visit 1 planet for every sec. you wont be done viewing planets for decades. Thats how much planets there are.

It\'s a game where you simply explore space. It\'s placed in the Virgo supercluster, and it procedurally generates everything that isn\'t put in manually, leaving you with billions and billions (or maybe trillions?) of places to explore. But it\'s hard on a computer, so you need to be prepared for crashes if you don\'t have the stuff to run it.

Awesome...

I just tried to DL it from the site, but the torrent is dead, one of the mirrors is in Russian and I haven\'t a clue what\'s going on, two of the mirrors aren\'t working (keep telling me I have maxed out my accesses to the site or something), and the last mirror is Megaupload. Do you have the Zip? Could you host it possibly?

Awesome...

I just tried to DL it from the site, but the torrent is dead, one of the mirrors is in Russian and I haven\'t a clue what\'s going on, two of the mirrors aren\'t working (keep telling me I have maxed out my accesses to the site or something), and the last mirror is Megaupload. Do you have the Zip? Could you host it possibly?

Go to the Russian one (first one), do the code thing on the bottom left, then it will lead you to a page with an orange shaded area with a checkbox + a link on top of it. Uncheck the box, click the link and there you go, it should download. I\'m trying to upload it somewhere but the .rar is either too large or it takes too long to upload.

Edit: Also, if you have Chrome, go to it with that and it should give you an option for chrome to try and translate the site. Makes it a lot easier.

Edit: And the second depositfile mirror is working for me.

No, I just googled it and then got if off a 4shared. If you\'re wondering if it\'s his song, no, it\'s by Claude Debussy.

no, he calls it classical class, but never told anyone who made it.

Go to the Russian one (first one), do the code thing on the bottom left, then it will lead you to a page with an orange shaded area with a checkbox + a link on top of it. Uncheck the box, click the link and there you go, it should download. I\'m trying to upload it somewhere but the .rar is either too large or it takes too long to upload.

Edit: Also, if you have Chrome, go to it with that and it should give you an option for chrome to try and translate the site. Makes it a lot easier.

Edit: And the second depositfile mirror is working for me.

Russian Link worked, thanks man.

EDIT: Checked your other videos out, they\'re awesome too. Good work.

What\'s your rig? I tried running it but I went down to the surface of a planet and it crashed when I tried to go too fast. I was getting rendering issues too.

I have a Core2Quad 6600, Stock 4850 512MB, 4GB 667MHz DDR2, Gigabyte G33M-DS2R...

Russian Link worked, thanks man.

EDIT: Checked your other videos out, they\'re awesome too. Good work.

What\'s your rig? I tried running it but I went down to the surface of a planet and it crashed when I tried to go too fast. I was getting rendering issues too.

I have a Core2Quad 6600, Stock 4850 512MB, 4GB 667MHz DDR2, Gigabyte G33M-DS2R...

Thanks.

Mine:

AMD Athlon II X4 635 Processor (4 CPUs), ~ 2.9GHz

4096 MB RAM (I believe DDR3 after a bit of searching)

AMD Radeon HD 6770 1024MB GDDR 5

Thanks.

4096 MB RAM (I believe DDR3 after a bit of searching)
